titles.title: To authorize the transfer of naval vessels to certain foreign countries.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Mr. Hamilton moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Armed Services.

calendar.text: Committee on Armed Services. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Armed Services. Reported to Senate by Senator Nunn without amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 149.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 7/13/1993--Passed House amended. Authorizes the Secretary of the Navy to transfer to: (1) Argentina an auxiliary repair dry dock; (2) Australia the guided missile destroyer Goldsborough; (3) Chile an auxiliary repair dry dock; (4) Greece the guided missile destroyer Richard E. Byrd; (5) a Taiwan instrumentality the auxiliary repair dry dock Windsor; (6) Turkey the frigates Reasoner, Fanning, Thomas C. Hart, and Capodanno; and (7) Turkey the frigate Elmer Montgomery. Waives certain congressional notification requirements with respect to such transfers. Requires transfer costs to be borne by the recipients. Terminates the transfer authority two years after enactment of this Act, with an exception.
